info.comments: CVSS V2 temporal score updated from "4" to "4.3".
CVSS V3 temporal score updated from "6.8" to "7".

consequence.value: Malicious users could use this vulnerability to change partial contents or configuration on the system. Additionally this vulnerability can also be used to cause a limited denial of service in the form of interruptions in resource availability.

explt.desc: A stack buffer overflow exists in the ec_glob function of editorconfig-core-c before v0.12.6 which allowed an attacker to arbitrarily write to the stack and possibly allows remote code execution. editorconfig-core-c v0.12.6 resolved this vulnerability by bound checking all write operations over the p_pcre buffer.

diagnosis.value:
Fedora has released a security update for editorconfig to fix the vulnerabilities.

Affected OS:
Fedora 37

pci_reasons.value: The QID adheres to the PCI requirements based on the CVSS basescore.

solution.value:
Refer to Fedora security advisory Fedora 37 for updates and patch information.

Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:

ABCDEFG-2023-6e5d4757df:Fedora 37

vulnerability.description: A stack buffer overflow exists in the ec_glob function of editorconfig-core-c before v0.12.6 which allowed an attacker to arbitrarily write to the stack and possibly allows remote code execution. editorconfig-core-c v0.12.6 resolved this vulnerability by bound checking all write operations over the p_pcre buffer.

consequence.value: Malicious users could use this vulnerability to change partial contents or configuration on the system. Additionally this vulnerability can also be used to cause a limited denial of service in the form of interruptions in resource availability.

explt.desc: A stack buffer overflow exists in the ec_glob function of editorconfig-core-c before v0.12.6 which allowed an attacker to arbitrarily write to the stack and possibly allows remote code execution. editorconfig-core-c v0.12.6 resolved this vulnerability by bound checking all write operations over the p_pcre buffer.

vulnerability.description: A stack buffer overflow exists in the ec_glob function of editorconfig-core-c before v0.12.6 which allowed an attacker to arbitrarily write to the stack and possibly allows remote code execution. editorconfig-core-c v0.12.6 resolved this vulnerability by bound checking all write operations over the p_pcre buffer.
